conclusion: Determine the maximum distance from the optical axis for the incident ray resulting in emerging light using refraction and hemisphere geometry.
Depicts a glass hemisphere with center O, radius R, and optical axis. Parallel light is incident vertically on the base.
Refractive index of glass is 1.5; light beam comes from air with refractive index 1.
Calculate critical angle \(\theta_c\) using \(\sin \theta_c = \frac{1}{1.5}\), resulting in \(\theta_c \approx 41.81^\circ\).
Maximum distance from optical axis corresponds to ray at critical angle \(\theta_c\).
Maximum distance \(d\) is when incident ray forms right angle with normal at base.
Maximum distance from optical axis for incident ray is equal to radius of hemisphere.
